Hallo!



I got a question on my forum. It's a Japanese sword Mei: Tamban no Kami
Fujiwara terukado or tamban no kami terukado saku. You can se pitchers on
this link: http://www.sharpweaponcenter.com/portal/index.php?option=com_smf
<http://www.sharpweaponcenter.com/portal/index.php?option=com_smf
<http://www.sharpweaponcenter.com/portal/index.php?option=com_smf
<http://www.sharpweaponcenter.com/portal/index.php?option=com_smf&Itemid=114
> &Itemid=114
> &Itemid=114
&?topic=204.msg548;topicseen#new>
&Itemid=114&?topic=204.msg548;topicseen#new. At the bottom of the page.



Please can any one tell more about this sword?

You can send me the answer here.



Mvh



Per- Erik (Pelle) Eriksson

messages.subject: Japanese Book on Tsuba on-line
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.db.fks.ed.jp/txt/20011.002/index.html This is an interesting book on-line from Japan on a tsuba collection which was left to a museum.  You can
messages.messageBody:
http://www.db.fks.ed.jp/txt/20011.002/index.html

This is an interesting book on-line from Japan on a tsuba collection
which was left to a museum. You can forward page by page through the
book and hit the individual pictures for enlargements. About 170 pgs.
Very interesting pieces and nicely done.
